result.execSummary:
All charges against Blong Vang in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Blong Vang is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Blong Vang

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation. Filed by Atty Renc.

1:30 p.m.  Defendant Blong Vang in court with Attorney (Atty) Anne Renc.  Defendant Blong Vang in custody.  Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 21CF4, 21CF527 and 22CF55.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
21CF4:
Count 1 - Dismissed
Count 2 - Dismissed 

21CF527:
Count 1 - Dismissed 
Count 2 - No contest 
Count 3 - Dismissed
Count 4 - Dismissed 
Count 5 - Dismissed 
Count 6 - Dismissed
Count 7 - Dismissed 
Count 8 - Dismissed

22CF55:
Count 1 - Dismissed 
Count 2 - Dismissed
Count 3 - Dismissed 
Count 4 - Dismissed 
Count 5 - Dismissed 
Count 6 - Dismissed 
Count 7 - Dismissed 

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 2 in 21CF527:  Vehicle Operator  Flee/Elude Offficer 346.04(3).
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.

Dismissed Without Prejudice:  Counts 1, 3-8 in 21CF527
Dismissed Without Prejudice:  All counts in 21CF4
Dismissed Without Prejudice:  All counts in 22CF55

State has complied with victim notification statutes.
No victim appears in court and no restitution is being sought.

ADA Dodge makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Sentencing is a joint recommendation.
Defendant does not make a statement prior to sentencing. 

BY THE COURT:
21CF527:
Count 2 -
Impose but STAY a 180 day jail sentence
Huber for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
Eligible to serve the last 50 days of the jail sentence on GPS home monitor, if he qualifes after an assessment by the Sheriff's Dept.
Placed on Probation for a Period of 3 Years -
**Conditions of Probation:
50 days conditional jail 
Credit for 50 days 
Time served 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
Participate in any counseling or assessments as deemed appropriate by the agent.
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Provide a DNA sample
Plea hearing on February 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:37 a.m.   Defendant Blong Vang in court with Attorney (Atty) Anne Renc. Defendant Blong Vang in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Dodge calls the case and states the appearances.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on February 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:12 p.m.  Defendant Blong Vang in court with Attorney (Atty) Anne Renc. Defendant Blong Vang in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 21CF4, 21CF527 and 22CF55.

Court calls the case.
ADA Dodge states the appearances.
ADA Dodge states that the Initial Appearance, Waiver of Preliminary Hearing/Arraignment need to be held on 22CF55.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
21CF4:
Count 1 -
Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In (DRI)

21CF527:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In (DRI)
Count 2 -
Count 3 - Dismissed and Read In (DRI)
Count 4 - Dismissed and Read In (DRI)
Count 5 - Dismissed and Read In (DRI)
Count 6 - Dismissed and Read In (DRI)
Count 7 - Dismissed and Read In (DRI)
Count 8 - Dismissed and Read In (DRI)

22CF55:
Count 1 -
Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In (DRI)
Count 3 -
Count 4 - Dismissed and Read In (DRI)
Count 5 - Dismissed and Read In (DRI)
Count 6 - Dismissed and Read In (DRI)
Count 7 - Dismissed and Read In (DRI)

Court questions ADA Dodge with regards to victims in the cases.
ADA Dodge states that there is no victim on 21CF4 and have not complied with victim notification and consultation.
Victims have been contacted in 21CF527 and 22CF55.

Court will not be able to proceed with this plea/sentencing today.

BY THE COURT:
PTC to be set on 21CF4, 21CF527 and 22CF55
Arraignment to be set on 22CF55.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

02:12 PM Defendant Blong Vang in court with Attorney (Atty) Anne Renc. Defendant Blong Vang in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

State recommends a $ bond with conditions as stated.
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
